content.description: Use a nice side pull right hand and a left edge for a little compression start. Work up problem through series of crimps and jugs. Could be made significantly harder with sit start.
content.location: About 10 yards right of the main trail coming from the parking lot. Same Boulder as "Blood Root" but this problem faces the trail (West).

content.description: Sit start low, just to the right of the starting holds for “spelunkers” on to crimpy holds. Work way up the right side of the boulder, overhanging a bit on nice ledges and good feet. Pretty bad landing, lots of rocks.
content.location: Right in the center of everything. Right side of “plaza boulder.” Map coming soon

content.description: Stand start on the left side of the boulder. Work your way through slopers and pinchers to the right then for the jug near the tree.  Top out
content.location: as you first arrive to the boulders look to your left though the crack of two large walls and you will see the onix boulder, to get there you have to walk around them and you will notice a cool columnar rock formation.

content.description: Fun little boulder problem. Sit start with the crux being the first move to a two finger pocket. Figure out your way up from there.
content.location: Follow the trail to the top and look to your right for a stubby boulder with an obvious sit start.

content.description: A must try problem if you're going to Fort Windham! Difficult sit start with gnarly crimps and a heel hook first move to a left hand hold. From there climb right using some edges and a big move to get your left hand over on the side pull. find your feet and shoot for the jug, scramble your way up and top out.
content.location: Once arriving to the rocks, turn right off the trail once you notice a secondary trail branch that way and over a fallen tree.  Once you’re right beside the boulders, follow them around the backside, keeping them to your left until you reach a nice, slightly inverted bouldering wall with a pristine landing and the crimpy sit start on the bottom left. The landing is really nice despite a few rocks, there should be two 25-30' rock towers to the right of the face.

content.description: Unique problem for the area! Start in the deepest part of the cave like off width hole. Invert to start and thrutch your way until you can spin into the squeeze. Have fun and bring some tums
content.location: The obvious wide dark cave to the right of hot and bothered.

content.description: Jugs galore. Easy climb but BEWARE, STEEP 20-30 FT DROP OFF right after topout, not much room to move up there.
content.location: Follow trail to the top of rocks. Once at the top it's the rock on your left with the nice landings. Right across trail from "johnny cakes"

content.description: Sit start to begin the climb and move right to first crimp. Use only small crimps all the way to a juggy hold then work your way through the mellow top out.
content.location: Once you arrive to the rocks at the fort keep going straight for a few seconds then look to your right. Blood Root boulder should be a a short distance in front of you in the center of the entire area. It’s large but not the largest, it sits just in front of the three biggest, saucer shaped rocks. This problem is on the left face of the boulder.

content.description: In Shenanadoah National Park just off Skyline Drive near MM 10. Quality greenstone in a nice shady area. Can be crowded with hikers on weekends but climbers are sparse. There’s definitely something to do for every skill level.
